intro: Satureja thymbrifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, lance-shaped leaves with a strong, pungent aroma. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Satureja thymbrifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a culinary herb due to its distinctive flavor and medicinal properties.
